Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black part of elaborate rosette and lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre, above two white lines; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos incorrectly identifies the elaborate rosette as tendrils.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1154) (phase 2)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 303, no. 1118, pl. 153, no. 1118)
